intro: Calydorea riograndensis, commonly known as the Rio Grande calydorea, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. It features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
